subject: Self Care
title: The Shutdown Ritual
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Shutdown Ritual.

hook.text: Cal Newport ends every workday with the phrase 'shutdown complete.' Then work thoughts stop. Completely.

buildup.text: A shutdown ritual closes open loops. You review tasks, plan tomorrow, and formally end the work day.

discovery.text: The Zeigarnik effect says unfinished tasks nag the brain. Writing them down releases the mental grip.

twist.text: Without a shutdown, work bleeds into evenings. You're technically off but mentally still at the office.

climax.text: Create a simple end-of-day checklist. Close the loops. Say the phrase. Let the evening belong to you.

punchline.text: End work formally. Your evenings deserve boundaries.

quiz.question: What does the Zeigarnik effect explain?
options: Why unfinished tasks continue to nag the mind
